org.codehaus.groovy.grails.plugins.gwt
[Groovy] Class GwtController

java.lang.Object
  javax.servlet.GenericServlet
      javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
          com.google.gwt.user.server.rpc.AbstractRemoteServiceServlet
              com.google.gwt.user.server.rpc.RemoteServiceServlet
                  org.codehaus.groovy.grails.plugins.gwt.GwtController

class GwtController
extends com.google.gwt.user.server.rpc.RemoteServiceServlet

Custom controller that dispatches GWT client requests to the appropriate Grails service.

Property Summary
org.codehaus.groovy.grails.commons.GrailsApplication grailsApplication

The Grails application instance is injected here.

java.lang.Object index

The default action simply delegates to the GWT RemoteServiceServlet.
 
Constructor Summary
GwtController()

 
Method Summary
java.util.Enumeration getInitParameterNames()

Dummy versions of getter methods because the real ones throw an exception.

javax.servlet.ServletContext getServletContext()

Since this class is not instantiated as a proper servlet, we override this method to provide the servlet context.

java.lang.String getServletInfo()

java.lang.String getServletName()

java.lang.String processCall(java.lang.String payload)

Overrides the standard GWT servlet method, dispatching RPC requests to services.

Property Detail

grailsApplication

org.codehaus.groovy.grails.commons.GrailsApplication grailsApplication
The Grails application instance is injected here. We use it to get hold of the Spring application context.

index

java.lang.Object index
The default action simply delegates to the GWT RemoteServiceServlet.

 
Constructor Detail

GwtController

GwtController()

 
Method Detail

getInitParameterNames

java.util.Enumeration getInitParameterNames()
Dummy versions of getter methods because the real ones throw an exception. This is a workaround for the fact that Grails likes to call all the getter methods on controllers. No idea why.

getServletContext

javax.servlet.ServletContext getServletContext()
Since this class is not instantiated as a proper servlet, we override this method to provide the servlet context. This allows various bits of the GWT server-side code to work properly.

getServletInfo

java.lang.String getServletInfo()

getServletName

java.lang.String getServletName()

processCall

java.lang.String processCall(java.lang.String payload)
Overrides the standard GWT servlet method, dispatching RPC requests to services.
